Modal dialog (pop-up windows)

Modal dialog (pop-up windows)

Alert the user to information they need to know at that point in time with a pop-up window.

On this page
  • Visual design
  • Guidelines for use
  • Layouts
  • Examples and assets

Visual design

Design view:

Mobile design

Desktop designs can be viewed on screens wider than 650px.

Modal title

  • HTML
  • CSS

Guidelines for use

Purpose:

Used to attract the users attention to important information during a process.

The modal dialog appears on top of the main content which is disabled until the modal is closed.

When to use this component:

Modal dialogs can disrupt to the user experience and should not be used often. Only use them to aid the user in completing a workflow or process.

Use modals to:

  • Display important warnings or correct critical errors.
  • Allow the user to enter information for continuing a current process.
  • Break up a complex workflow into simpler steps.

Layouts

Page layouts

Modal components can be used in full width or 2/3rd width pages.

Component layout options

Full width layout

Desktop, Tablet & Mobile: One component in a row.
